TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WSHttpSecurity extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the security settings for the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding> class is designed for interoperation with services that implement WS-* specifications. The transport security for this binding is Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) over HTTP, or HTTPS.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets the message-level security settings for this binding.
Docs.value:
A instance.
The default value includes: <xref:System.ServiceModel.NonDualMessageSecurityOverHttp.EstablishSecurityContext%2A> with default set to , <xref:System.ServiceModel.MessageSecurityOverHttp.ClientCredentialType%2A> is <xref:System.ServiceModel.MessageCredentialType>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.MessageSecurityOverHttp.AlgorithmSuite%2A> is <xref:System.ServiceModel.Security.SecurityAlgorithmSuite.Basic256%2A>, and <xref:System.ServiceModel.MessageSecurityOverHttp.NegotiateServiceCredential%2A> is .

remarks.format:

Docs.summary: Specifies the message <xref:System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode> for this binding.
Docs.value: The <xref:System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode> for this binding. The default is <xref:System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode>.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property determines whether the settings from the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpSecurity.Transport%2A> and/or <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpSecurity.Message%2A> property buckets may or may not become effective.
## Examples The following code sets this property.

Docs.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpSecurity.Transport%2A> property has changed from its default value and should be serialized.
Docs.returns: if the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpSecurity.Transport%2A> property value should be serialized; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets an object that contains the transport-level security settings for this binding.
Docs.value:
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpTransportSecurity> for this binding.
The default value includes a <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpTransportSecurity.ClientCredentialType%2A> of <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpClientCredentialType> and a <xref:System.ServiceModel.HttpTransportSecurity.ProxyCredentialType%2A> of .

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the object returned by this property to set the transport security settings for the binding.
## Examples The following code sets the client credential type to Windows.
```c# // The code uses a shortcut to specify the security mode to Transport. WSHttpBinding b = new WSHttpBinding(SecurityMode.Transport); b.Security.Transport.ClientCredentialType = HttpClientCredentialType.Windows; ```
```vb# ' The code uses a shortcut to specify the security mode to Transport. Dim b As WSHttpBinding = new WSHttpBinding(SecurityMode.Transport) b.Security.Transport.ClientCredentialType = HttpClientCredentialType.Windows ```
